metadata.feature_description: Generate and manage RSS feeds for published posts

steps.action: Navigate to News page with Publisher module
steps.expected: Publisher module loads with RSS feed link visible in social sharing area
steps.actual: Publisher module loaded successfully on News page with RSS feed link visible at http://localhost:8081/en-us/News/view/rss

steps.action: Locate RSS feed icon in Publisher module social sharing section
steps.expected: RSS icon/link is displayed alongside other social sharing options (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Pinterest)
steps.actual: RSS feed link found in social sharing area between Featured and Latest posts sections

steps.action: Click on RSS feed link to generate RSS feed
steps.expected: RSS feed XML is generated and displayed
steps.actual: RSS feed was generated successfully. Browser navigated to http://localhost:8081/en-us/News/view/rss and displayed valid RSS 2.0 XML content

steps.action: Examine the generated RSS feed XML structure
steps.expected: RSS feed follows valid RSS 2.0 XML format with proper elements
steps.actual: RSS feed contains valid RSS 2.0 structure: XML declaration (version 1.0, UTF-8 encoding), rss element with version 2.0, channel element with link (http://localhost:8081/en-us/News), language (en-US), and item elements

steps.action: Verify feed items contain required RSS elements
steps.expected: Each item contains title, link, description, pubDate, and author
steps.actual: Both items in feed contain: link (post URL), author (user display name), title (post title), description (post body as HTML), and pubDate (RFC 822 format timestamp). Example: 'Workflow Test Post - Claude Testing' by SuperUser Account, pubDate 'Fri, 09 Jan 2026 17:09:23 Z'

observations: RSS feed is accessible via the URL pattern /News/view/rss from Publisher module pages
Feed title and description elements are empty in the generated feed (page title/description not set)
RSS is controlled by RssEnabled setting in ShareSettingsManager.cs (default false)
Feed maximum items controlled by Publisher_RssMaxPosts portal setting (default 20)
SyndicationFeedHelper.cs handles RSS feed generation using .NET SyndicationFeed API
Feed includes Atom namespace reference (xmlns:a10) for extended compatibility
